lines.text: Paris - London's love nest.
You don't care how you make me keep people waiting, do you?
No, not other women.
That woman was my uncle.
Monsieur must have a very charming wife to be so jealous.
Oh, not bad, a trifle faded, perhaps. But, what a temper! Oh, mon Dieu!
Doctor, will you be finished with me soon?
Oh, I really must go.
Not until you promise to come again.
Oh, I don't know.
Come, say yes. You told me you took your happiness where you found it. Say yes, to life. Say yes, to love. Say yes, to me.
You ungrateful young puppy!

You're just as bad as your father. They shipped him to Canada to make a man of him. But, he got no further than the nightclubs of New York, flinging his money to the four winds. And you're just like him! Only your flinging mine.
Uncle George, I'm awfully sorry, really I am.
Well, this is the end, Robert. You'll toss no more of my money to the book-makers and chorus girls. I can forgive an attraction for a charming woman of our own class.
You confounded young scoundrel!
The point is this! You have creditors - no matter. You have love affairs - no matter. You throw money out of the window - !
No matter.
Your bills, tailors, bootmakers, hatters are enormous! In fact, you're living beyond my means.
So you propose...
So you should put a stop to this and settle down at once. And by that I mean marriage.
I have the very girl for you.
I know. Well breed. Well educated. Virtuous. Healthy. And just about as exciting as a dish of mashed potatoes.

I'd like to marry if I could find a wife I could trust. But, I know too much about women. Do you ever see these modern girls with their husbands? No, they're always with someone else's husband. Or, running around with gigolos, hired dancing partners.

Do you know how they breed roses, Lord Hampton? It's terribly interesting. I only found it out today. A rose, Lord Hampton, is both male and female. And in order to get little new kind of roses, well, they have to do the most peculiar things.
Oh, darling, I want a cocktail.
What sort of a cocktail?
Let's have a sidecar!
That's old stuff, Mama. We're more advanced now. Schnetzenhauser said in his famous book on sex relations that...
My dear child, however did you come across that book?
What book is this? Why haven't I heard of it?

Oh, you wouldn't understand it, Mama. Lord Hampton, if I'm going into a strange country, I need a guidebook, don't I? If you go into a jungle, you want to know what's behind the next tree. A girl of today should know everything, read everything and do everything.
Yes, my soul, you have brought her up well, Jane - in the modern manner.
Yes. I didn't mean her to be quite so modern; but, she - just turned out that way.
Oh, darling, I just have to think, I have a date. I'm dancing here today.
Dancing? With who?
The sweetest gigolo.
A hired dancing partner?
Everybody has one, darling. You hire a professional dancer, just as you would a riding master.
I want to get the inside, eh, dope on him.
Dope?

Oh, quite right. As Schnetzenhauser says in his famous book on sex, if you're going into the jungle, you want to know what's behind the next tree. A young girl of today should know life as it really is.
You two seem to have been exchanging ideas.
Let's show them those new steps.
Shall we start with the knee-to-knee half turn?
Lovely.
[Dancing]
Don't you love it Lord Hampton?
[to Robert]
Now, let's show them Passions Deep.
Oh, impudent hound, that!
I don't think my nephew would approve of this young - jackanapes!
I tell you Jane, that fellow's dangerous.
A gigolo. Nonsense, George.
A gigolo - that's just it! These fellows are experts at leading girls into mischief.
An English mother knows an English daughter, George.
She's a beautiful dancer.
Gwyneth? Oh, not bad.
Oh, very good. She has technique.
You mean I haven't technique?
I mean you don't need technique.
Would you like a stroll?
I'd love to.
Who's the man?
Oh, that's not a man. It's a gigolo.
I'm getting awfully hot.
So am I!
Believe it or not, we were just practicing a new dance step.
Really dear, there must be very little left for you to learn.
A gardenia in the button hole seems to be indicated.
I have one for you, sir.
You infernal young jackanapes!
Robert, I know what you're up to and I will not tolerate it. You're going too far!
On the contrary, sir, I haven't gone as far as I had hoped - as yet.
Oh, Uncle George, you ought to be toodlin' - won't you sir?
Yes. I'm going.
Now, just relax in my arms. Now, a little sway from the hips. Toward me. Closer. Closer, still. Wonderful!
Our tango. We shall never dance together again.
Give me this one evening. Let's slip away to some quiet place together. That quaint little inn in San Sebastian. A plane leaves at half past eight, Roxy. What do you say?

All I dare of you is my love. An hour of happiness that will leave us with wonderful memories. That's all we have. But, we shall have lived, we shall have loved, we shall have known romance. Roxy, say yes. Say yes, to life. Say yes, to love. Say yes, to me.
When Martin made love to me, I slap his face. I say, I will not be kissed by the valet of a gigolo.
Oh, you mean a crest!
Yes, that is it. The paper he writes on, his pajamas, his underwear even. He has hid those things from you.
Oh, well I should hope so!

So, Lord Robert Brummel is afraid I'm like all the other women he's known. He wouldn't marry Roxan Hartley without finding out if she's worthy of him - and after he's made love to half the women of Europe!
Naturellement! Men - you know, they are all the same way. They want to try every woman in the world for themselves; but, their wives, that's a coat of a different color.
Are you ready?
Rather!
Oh, I've never been so thrilled in all my life. Our first flight - to Heaven. It's going to be a glorious sensation.
You like sensations, don't you?
Pleasant ones, of course.
I'm dizzy too, but not from a plane. I'm dizzy with joy! More joy, darling.
[Hands him her champagne glass]
You've had too much joy already.
Oh, darling, I thought you were my suitor not my Sunday school teacher.
You were perfect, darling! I'm sure he thought we'd been married for years.
We're alone now. Aren't you thrilled!
You think of everything, too, don't you.
Well, of course, old dear. Just a girl who knows her weekends, that's all.
Why, only this afternoon, you told me you'd never - cheat - on the man you'd marry.
Oh, I always say that at first. Cocktail, darling. A girl can't tell the truth to every man that makes love to her, can she?
Then, my riding master was next. Hmmm. Jolly old chap, Tony. Spanish! Hmmm. What a lot I learned from Tony. Hmmm. Then, there was a fascinating actor from Russia.
Oh, that idiot! I wouldn't marry him if he was the last man on earth. What a rotter he is! Imagine Mama wanting me to marry such a vulgar.
What was in that box?
Oh, darling, how naughty you are. Pajamas, of course.
Carry me in - my conqueror.
Naughty boy! Don't you come in!
Roxy, let me in.
You unspeakable cad! I never hated and despised anyone so - in all my life.
Darling!
You beast! You brute! You swine!
Darling, I love you!
You come in here and I'll turn on the shower!
